text: Keith Matthew Spurgeon (1932 – December 1984) was an English football player and manager. ==Playing career== Spurgeon played for Tottenham Hotspur, Margate, Leytonstone, Folkestone Town, Herne Bay and Snowdown Colliery Welfare. In October 1960 he was hired as a coach by Clapton, where he also had been used as a player to cover for injuries, on at least one occasion. ==Coaching career== Spurgeon was manager of Dutch clubs Ajax from 1961 to 1962, Heracles Almelo from 1963 to 1964, Blauw-Wit Amsterdam and AGOVV and he later coached the Libyan national side, the Dallas Tornado of the North American Soccer League, Belgian side K.V. Mechelen Swedish side AIK, Cypriot side APOEL, and Landskrona, also of Sweden. ==Later life and death== He died in Sweden in 1984, from motor neurone disease. ==References== ==External links== * Profile Category:1932 births Category:1984 deaths Category:English footballers Category:English football managers Category:English expatriate football managers Category:Tottenham Hotspur F.C. players Category:Margate F.C. players Category:Leytonstone F.C. players Category:Folkestone F.C. players Category:Herne Bay F.C. players Category:Snowdown Colliery Welfare F.C. players Category:Clapton F.C. players Category:AFC Ajax managers Category:Blauw-Wit Amsterdam managers Category:Heracles Almelo managers Category:AGOVV Apeldoorn managers Category:Libya national football team managers Category:North American Soccer League (1968–1984) coaches Category:KV Mechelen managers Category:Lierse S.K. managers Category:AIK Fotboll managers Category:APOEL FC managers Category:Landskrona BoIS managers Category:Association football defenders Category:English expatriates in the Netherlands Category:Expatriate football managers in the Netherlands Category:British expatriates in Libya Category:Expatriate football managers in Libya Category:English expatriates in the United States Category:Expatriate soccer managers in the United States Category:English expatriates in Belgium Category:Expatriate football managers in Belgium Category:English expatriates in Sweden Category:Expatriate football managers in Sweden Category:English expatriates in Cyprus Category:Expatriate football managers in Cyprus
title: Keith Spurgeon
